public class MainMenuController extends ViewController

  • Method Details

    • initialize

      protected void initialize()
      Specified by:
      initialize in class ViewController

    • createGame

      public void createGame()
      Creates a new game with the selected number of players.

      This method retrieves the number of players from a combo box, sets it in the application, and attempts to create a game on the server with the specified number of players. If the game is successfully created, the game ID is set in the application. If there is a remote exception during the creation process, a server crash warning is displayed.

      Note: The line to load the lobby scene is commented out because it does not work in its current state.

    • showCreateGameMenu

      public void showCreateGameMenu()
      Toggles the visibility of the create game menu and updates the UI elements accordingly.

      This method performs the following actions based on the current state of step1:

      • If step1 is true:
      • Displays the create game menu by setting its visibility and managed properties to true.
      • Hides the general menu by setting its visibility and managed properties to false.
      • Changes the text of the create game button to "Back".
      • Updates the visibility of image views to reflect the current menu state.
      • Sets step1 to false.
      • If step1 is false:
      • Hides the create game menu and join game menu by setting their visibility and managed properties to false.
      • Displays the general menu by setting its visibility and managed properties to true.
      • Changes the text of the create game button to "Create Game".
      • Updates the visibility of image views to reflect the current menu state.
      • Sets step1 to true.

      Additionally, this method hides the warning label.

    • showJoinGameMenu

      public void showJoinGameMenu()
      Displays the join game menu and updates the UI elements accordingly.

      This method performs the following actions:

      • Displays the join game menu by setting its visibility and managed properties to true.
      • Hides the general menu by setting its visibility and managed properties to false.
      • Changes the text of the create game button to "Back".
      • Hides the second image view to reflect the current menu state.
      • Sets step1 to false.

      Additionally, this method hides the warning label.

    • joinGame

      public void joinGame()
      Attempts to join a game using the game ID provided by the user.

      This method performs the following actions:

      • Validates the game ID to ensure it contains only digits.
      • If the game ID is valid, attempts to join the game by calling joinGame on the client.
      • If a RemoteException occurs, displays an error alert indicating a server crash.
      • If the game ID is invalid, displays a warning message instructing the user to input only numbers.

    • showGames

      public void showGames()
      Requests the list of available games from the server.

      This method performs the following actions:

      • Attempts to get the game list by calling getGameList on the client.
      • If no games are available, throws a RuntimeException wrapping the NoGamesException.
      • If a RemoteException occurs, displays an error alert indicating a server crash.

    • showRules

      public void showRules()
      Loads the rulebook scene.

      This method sets the application window size to the rulebook window size and then loads the rulebook scene.

    • setMessage

      public void setMessage(String message)
      Sets a warning message and makes the warning label visible. Called by the server to show a warning
      Overrides:
      setMessage in class ViewController
      Parameters:
      message - the message to be displayed in the warning label

    • handleInGamePlayers

      public void handleInGamePlayers(LinkedHashMap<String,Boolean> players)
      Description copied from class: ViewController
      This method is implemented in GameList and MainMenu controllers to just set the player list, in Lobby controller to modify the player list and update the lobby and in InGamePlayer to show disconnected and surrendered players
      Overrides:
      handleInGamePlayers in class ViewController
